CTASection.content: Hi, I'm Raúl! I like creating clean, responsive and functional web apps.

paragraph.text: I started studying web development with the help of The Odin Project.
Thanks to the great list of resources they use, I was able to obtain new learning skills, to study web fundamentals and the basics of Front End development.

paragraph.subtitle: A formal education
paragraph.text: Then I enrolled in Acámica’s Full Stack Web Development program in Buenos Aires, Argentina.
I learned to build interactive websites using JavaScript ES6, to work with a team following the agile methodology and even to develop an entire API using Node.js!
In 2020 I completed the Acámica program, added features and made improvements to projects I’d already started, and also learned React.js on my own.

paragraph.subtitle: Thereafter
paragraph.text: I started working as a freelancer and since I got to collaborate with different clients with different requirements I learned how to adapt so I could fulfill the needs at hand and deliver results.
Currently I continue studying (always!) and look forward to join a proactive, innovative team filled with empathic people where I can continue growing both personally and professionally.

projects.name: Hacemos Tu Sociedad
projects.summary: Landing page built along the Estudio Mixto team. Responsible for implementing the previously designed visual elements and creating interaction states on the UI.

projects.name: Personal website
projects.summary: The website you're currently on! I designed and implemented the complete user interface and user experience.

projects.name: GifOS
projects.summary: Web app that allows the user to make their own GIFs, search for their favourite ones and get recommendations. I used the GIPHY API and the RecordRTC library.

projects.name: ClasesIN
projects.summary: Multi-page website for an e-learning platform. Responsible for developing the previously designed user interface and communicating directly with the UI designer to ease-up the development process.

footerSection.content: Made with React.js, TailwindCSS and a lot of ❤
